attributes.action: Elected politicians and senior civil servants to release their metadata
attributes.additional_details:
GCHQ and the NSA are apparently legally permitted to harvest and use the 'metadata' of UK and overseas citizens.

Mr William Hagues, Foreign Secretary, says that law-abiding citizens have 'nothing to fear' from the collection of their metadata.

I therefore petition the government to release on a monthly basis the communications metadata of all Members of the House of Commons, House of Lords, Senedd i Gymru, Scottish Parliament, senior civil servants and special advisers.

If they have nothing to hide, they have nothing to fear.
